thread.title: Armed men stream 'three-hour gang rape' on Facebook Live after 'holding terrified victim at gunpoint'
thread.title_full: Armed men stream 'three-hour gang rape' on Facebook Live after 'holding terrified victim at gunpoint'

author: Rachel Bishop
title: Armed men stream 'three-hour gang rape' on Facebook Live after 'holding terrified victim at gunpoint'
text:
The alleged attack was screened on Facebook (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A woman was allegedly gang-raped in a brutal three hour attack that was broadcast over Facebook live. 
Horrified witnesses say men armed with guns streamed footage of themselves storming into the woman's home on Saturday night. 
They then allegedly tore off the victim’s clothes before sexually assaulting her. 
Police raced into the victim's home in Uppsala, Sweden, after a shocked woman saw the livestream on a closed Facebook group and raised the alarm. 
Josefine Lundgren, 21, called the police after realising what she was watching. The alleged rape took place in Uppsala The incident was reported by people who saw it on Facebook (Photo: Getty) 
She said: “He pulled her clothes off and lay on top of her.” 
Another online witness told Swedish newspaper Aftonbladet: "At first I thought it was a poorly orchestrated joke. Read More 
"The first thing you think is 'how can you do such a thing to a girl?' And how can you do it live? It is totally sick." 
Three people have been arrested after the shocking incident after forensics examined the apartment. 
Detectives are now examining the apartment where the alleged attack took place. Like us on Facebook
